radiographic_examinations.findings: The liver displays normal echogenic pattern and architecture without focal mass lesion identified within. There is no intrahepatic biliary ductal dilatation. The common duct size measures maximum dimension of 6 mm, which is upper limits of normal as before. The gallbladder is mildly dilated which is nonspecific and can be compatible with a fasting state. Numerous shadowing gallstones are again demonstrated within the gallbladder lumen as before. No gallbladder wall edema or pericholecystic fluid is identified to suggest acute cholecystitis. Real-time scanning by the radiology resident demonstrates diffuse mid and right upper quadrant abdominal pain.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: The common duct size and gallstones findings remain as before, with no new acute cholecystitis indicated.
